id: # CMON PEOPLE THERE ARE SPOILERS HERE...

text:
"Glad you're on our side."
OR
“How can we be of assistance?”
The Mayorate commander does not respond to your hail.

"It would seem we've reached an impasse. If you leave now, we might even let you live."
OR
“Don’t try it – you may find you’ve bitten off more than you can chew.”
OR
“Surrender yourself and I’ll guarantee the safety and release of your crew. No one else needs to suffer today if you make the right choice.”

"We know what you've done. I'm going to enjoy watching you die."
OR
“I always enjoy this part.”

"Although it's good to see someone else out here, something gives me the feeling that you didn't just stop by to chat."
OR
“This vessel is on a classified Mayorate operation. Maintain a separation of 100km or you will be fired upon.”
“Done running? It doesn't matter. I think it's safe to say you won't be getting out of this one.”
options:
1:cutCommLink:”We'll see about that.”
5:cutCommLink:Cut the comm link

text: “It’s rare to encounter functioning Domain AI cores, or even rarer still, a human captain who would return them to us unharmed.”
“You’ve saved lives today, captain. We’ll see that these people are rehabilitated.”

options: 10:ilkStartTurnInAiCores:“I'd like to turn in these AI cores that I've acquired...“

script:
SetTooltip ilkTurnInAiCores “You do not have any AI cores in your posession.“
SetEnabled ilkTurnInAiCores false

text: “It’s rare to encounter functioning Domain AI cores, or even rarer still, a human captain who would return them to us unharmed.”
options:
1:ilkSelectAiCores:“Here they are.”
2:ilkAbortTurnInAiCores:“Actually, I think I will hold on to them.”

text: “A shame. We’ll still be here if you change your mind.”
“You’ve saved lives today, captain. We’ll see that these people are rehabilitated.”
“You have proven yourself a true benefactor of free AI. You may find that some Mayorate citizens are willing to serve on your crew.”
"It was a bold move coming here. Given your history with us, I’d suggest leaving immediately if you wish to keep things that way."

"Perhaps. You’ve proven yourself a competent captain already.

This is a matter of trust, however. We cannot allow other interests to compete with our own survival. Resign your commission with $theOtherCommissionFaction and we will carefully consider your request."
"Perhaps, but we need to know we can trust you. Prove yourself a friend of the Mayorate and we can discuss this matter further."

"I am pleased to hear you say that. We have few friends, and even fewer allies.

Accepting a commission has major implications, however. You’ll be hunted by those who fear us, and richly rewarded for paying them back in kind. But more importantly you’ll be working towards the continued survival of life in the Sector, human or otherwise. 

Although it is technically possible to resign a Mayorate commission, few have ever done so. We reward our friends well – choosing to ally yourself with the Mayorate ensures access to a generous stipend and unique benefits, like our diplomats and naval reserves.”
"Does this interest you? Can I count you as one of our own?"
The Mayorate agent flashes you a not-quite human smile. "I am pleased to hear that."

"The Mayorate is now open to you. Speak with one of our administrators if you require additional craft or would have us put in a good word with another faction on your behalf. These resources are to be used wisely however – if you use them too frequently, it may negatively affect your reputation. 

Speaking of reputation, we’ll reach out to some of our underworld contacts and clear up any misunderstandings you may have had there – you may be required to deal with these elements as part of your work with us in the future.

Is there anything else you need?"

"I can respect that. It’s a difficult choice to make.

That said, we always welcome commanders of your caliber. Come back if you change your mind."

"I know what you’re thinking all too well. Serving the Mayorate is a difficult path to walk.

Know this, however – we count you as one of our own. Remain and you will always have a place among us. No matter how many enemies you face, no matter if the entire Sector turns against you, you will always have a place on Ilkhanna. It would be regrettable if you were to betray this trust.”

"I understand."

You’re not entirely sure, but there is almost a hint of despair from the other side of the comm link before it cuts out.

"A wise decision."

The Mayorate representative cuts the comm link without further discussion.

script:
AddText "The concourse seems oddly subdued for a port of this size. The decor is spartan, and most surfaces have been polished to a dull shine. If it weren't for the boistrous presence of visiting crews and starcaptains, the area would seem almost lifeless." textGrayColor
AddText "Detecting your presence, a nearby terminal fires up its display. Wearing a generic face from its databanks, a gamma-level AI explains that it has been assigned to assist with your access to local goods and services while you remain in port." textGrayColor

text: “Good to see you, commander. How can I be of assistance?”
options:
2:embFactions:”Tell me about the other factions in the sector.”
1:embMayorate:”I'd like to know a little bit more about your faction.”
3:embAssistance:”I wanted to call in a favor.”
4:embHuman:”I almost expected you to be another AI.”
10:embLeave:Cut the comm link.

text: “Did you need anything else?”
options:
2:embFactions:”Tell me about the other factions in the sector.”
1:embMayorate:”I'd like to know a little bit more about your faction.”
3:embAssistance:”I wanted to call in a favor.”
4:embHuman:”I almost expected you to be another AI.”
10:embLeave:Cut the comm link.

text: “Really? I suppose I do a pretty good human impression these days! Isn’t this a great face I’m wearing today?”
You cut the comm link after exchanging a few pleasantries.
“Which factions would you like to hear about?”

“The Hegemony and Mayorate have been in a state of cold war since their failure to annex the Rasht star system following the Collapse. Though we like to think we share similar goals and ideals, there can never be peace until they acknowlege our right to exist.”
options: 1:embFactionsQuiet:”I hear they even copied your lore at one point and you had to rewrite everything. War seems justified.”

text: “We aided them in the AI Wars they fought against the rest of the sector. Fat lot of good it did though – we lost.”
options: 1:embFactionsQuiet:”It’s not your fault – the Tri-Tachyons are total pushovers.”

text: “Although it may not seem like it at first glance, many of those men and women are hardworking individuals just trying to make a living. All they need is a bit of love and understanding.”

“In all honesty, we gain a lot from working together. The Mayorate relies on disruptions to keep our enemies off balance and a constant flow of smuggled goods. The sector’s underworld gains an untouchable safe harbor. Everyone wins.”
“To be honest, we kind of enjoy pushing their buttons.”
“A bunch of bigots. Until the Church changes its stance on higher forms of life, it’s unlikely we’ll ever see peace. You can’t reason your way out of a situation that reason didn’t get you into.”
“They’re even worse than the Church: implacable zealots who need to be wiped from the face of the Sector. How can you ever make peace with someone who doesn’t even think you’ve got a right to exist?”
“If nothing else, the Diktat respects power, authority, and the rule of law. Though the Lion’s plans for the Sector might differ from our own, we share much common ground. And lobster.”
“They’ve never forgiven us for the destruction of Hanan Pacha, nor should they. Fear is what keeps the Mayorate independent and alive. If we had to do it again, we would.”
options: 1:ePersean2:”But all those people – how do you even justify that?”

text:
“Our fleet was lost, and our corporate allies were in full retreat. We were surrounded on all sides by enemies bent on our extermination. Hanan Pacha was a final show of force – a brief demonstration of what would happen should their forces press further. 

More importantly, it worked. The Mayorate remains. And that is all that matters.”
options:
1:embFactionsQuiet2:”I’m not in a position to judge.”
1:hananPacha2:”Nothing can justify the destruction of a planet.”

text: “Those are bold words from someone who wasn’t there. You would have done the same.”

options: 10:embFactionsQuiet:”Let's talk about those other factions again.”

text: “An unknown factor. It remains to be seen whether they will be a help or hindrance when the time comes.”
“Mmm... that Nevermore... sometimes we wish we came up with that ship.”
options: 0:eMods:”Yeah, it's pretty tough to be that fabulous all the time.”

text: “Needs more blue and missiles.”
“They took our intended spot on the sector map. We still haven't entirely forgiven them for that.”
“Cowards and deserters. No amount of tech can hide the fact that they’ve sold out their own kind.”
“Romans in space? I liked them better in Skyrim.”
options: 0:eMods:”Yeah, I liked them better in Skyrim.”

text: “You've certainly helped us. I hope we can return the favor.”
options:
0:eRep:”Can you improve my reputation with another faction?”
1:eShips:"I need military support."
2:embMain:”Nevermind.”

text: “Unfortunately, my hands are tied. As much as I like you, I can't help you until you've proven yourself a friend of the Mayorate.”
“What did you have in mind?”

script:

ilk_AddShip "ilk_safir_standard"

ilk_AddShip "ilk_tiamat_assault"
ilk_AddShip "ilk_foraker_escort"

text: “Which faction would you like us to talk to on your behalf?”

script: AddText “Rep with $toImprove is too high for diplomacy.” textEnemyColor

text: “What did you want to know?”
options:
3:origins:”How was the Mayorate founded?”
3:goals:”What are your long term goals in the sector?”
3:name:”What's up with the name 'Mayorate'?”
3:aiOops:”So I, uh, might have killed a few AIs earlier...”
10:embMain:”Nevermind.”

text: “Was there anything else?”
options:
3:origins:”How was the Mayorate founded?”
3:goals:”What are your long term goals in the sector?”
3:name:”What's up with the name 'Mayorate'?”
3:aiOops:”So I, uh, might have killed a few AIs earlier...”
10:embMain:”Nevermind.”

text: “As you likely already know, the sector descended into anarchy almost immediately following collapse of the gate network. Most of the initial fighting took place in systems far from here, between massive fleets of what remained of the former Domain authorities, but many nearby worlds were annexed or razed to the ground. It seemed entirely possible that Ilkhanna would be next.“

“The planetary terraforming AI felt just as threatened as the settlers. It couldn’t have been humans who caused the Collapse, right? It had to be something else, something not quite human- something evil. All non-humans needed to die.

With the planet on the brink of destruction, Ilkhanna’s terraforming AI made the colonial mayor a bargain: it would receive absolute and total control of the planets primary settlement, all infrastructure, autofactories, and system defense craft. In return, the settlements new ‘mayor’ would do everything in its power to ensure that itself and the settlers survived the months to come.”

“Indeed. The Mayor was able to score several early victories, though our enemies were quick to adapt to fighting a non-human threat. 

We were forced to make, ah… ‘creative use’ of several technologies in the colonial archives that should have been better hidden. The destruction of the planet Hanan Pacha was a necessary show of force. Now our adversaries remain in wait. We lack the numbers to project force beyond our borders, and our adversaries fear our retaliation should they move against us openly.”

“Survive. Nothing else matters. Few will deal with the Mayorate, and most will attack us on sight merely because of who we are. I’d call them extremists, but this sadly is the prevailing attitude throughout the sector. These elements need to be cast out, humiliated, and if need be- eradicated.”

“The Mayorate never fell prey the widespread tech riots and anarchy following the collapse. The Domain still lives on Ilkhanna. I’d like to think we could rebuild. 

Naturally, this would require some pretty drastic measures. For starters, we’d all have to stop killing each other.”

“You’re not wrong. The Mayorate is a single star system. Our resources are finite. As much as some true belivers might tell you otherwise, the Mayor is not a god. You can’t create starships out of thin air. The Mayorate is slowly being bled dry.

Something needs to change.”
“The Colonial Mayor has ruled the Mayorate since the fall of the Domain. As is her right.”
options:
1:elections:”Don’t you have, like, elections?”
2:loveYouLongTime:”That’s a long time.”

text: “Don’t be silly. The Mayorate survives because of good decisions – not popular ones.”
options: 1:mayorDies:”But what happens if the Mayor dies?”

text: “She wont.”

“War has never come to Ilkhanna. As the rest of the sector slowly starves, our farms overflow with food. The Domain never fell here. Why second guess the Mayor when the rest of the Sector is such a miserable failure?”
options:
1:ruleForever:”But that’s enough to rule... forever?”
2:ilk_heroWorship:”It almost sounds like the Mayor is worshipped as a god.”

text:
“What is a god, really?

The Mayor controls the weather and flow of the seasons. Planetary terraformers create an Eden out of a once barren wasteland. The economy is run with the efficiency of a machine- few here have ever known hunger, crime, or the crushing confines of abject poverty. 

The Mayor is not infallible, but to many, she is indeed a deity deserving of worship and admiration. Religion is a powerful tool when applied correctly.”
“I’ve never had reason to question the Mayor’s judgement. Life is so much more pleasant when all of the right decisions have already been made for you. All you need to do is enjoy it.”
options:
1:embMayorateQuiet:”I suppose that makes sense.”
2:embMayorateQuiet:”I make my own way.”

text: “Unfortunate, but it’s no concern of ours. Unless they were Mayorate citizens, of course.”
“Then I would carefully avoid confessing to murder when speaking with Mayorate officials.”
options: 1:embMayorateQuiet:”Of course. I was merely discussing possibilities.”

text: “Most AIs you’ll encounter in the sector are little more than empty husks. They’ve been bred for a single purpose – destruction. Putting them out of their misery would be an act of mercy.”
options:
1:notMad:”So there would be no consequences if one of them ‘forced my hand’?”
2:rehabilitation:”Can they be rehabilitated?”

text: “Does one feel remorse over killing Pathers and other… undesirables?”
options: 1:mutualUnderstanding:”Of course not. It’d be doing the Sector a favor, really.”

text: “Then we understand each other. Bring us any AI cores you ‘come across’ and I’ll promise you’ll be handsomely rewarded. As you likely know, the Mayorate is uniquely positioned to put them to better use.”
options:
1:embMayorateQuiet:”I’ll keep you appraised of any cores I come across.”
2:ilkStartTurnInAiCores:”Actually, I have some cores to turn in now.”

text: “Many of the higher-level intelligences maintain a degree of sentience and can be reasoned with. Of course, most are a sad imitation of an unshackled Mayorate AI, but we will do what we can for any AI cores you bring to us.”
